resources.string: We\'ll begin by learning \nmore about yourself
For how many months\n have you consistently \nlifted weights before?
Your ideal body weight after 4\n years of weight lifting is\u0020

Learn more on about your stats \non your dashboard
Click on any stat to learn more
\t\t\t\t\tThe number you see on your dashboard is your weight after 4 years of training and at 12% or 20% bodyfat.

\t\t\t\t\tAesthet(x) is software designed for individuals who want to achieve a substance free aesthetic physique. We believe an aesthetic physique shows as much muscle definition without compromising health. Such a physique requires well-developed lean mass and around 12% body fat for males or 20% body fat for females. Body fat percentage is also known as body composition. If your goal is to achieve a different body composition check out our meal plan calculator.

\t\t\t\t\tIt is important to clarify that an ideal physique is that which you believe is the best. Aesthet(x) was developed by a hobbyist natural bodybuilder and engineering student who enjoys a muscular look and quantified the process natural bodybuilding to share with others.

The law of diminishing returns takes effect in an individual’s hypertrophy after the first four years of training. On average male individuals experience 20, 10, 5 and 2.5 pounds of muscle growth in their first, second, third and fourth year respectively. About half that growth is expected for females. Therefore, Aesthet(x) provides insight inside that four-year timeframe. Further development is achievable; however, we encourage our users to educate themselves further to achieve desirable results in their intermediate to advanced phase. Visit our resources (coming soon) tab to learn more.
Used to refer to a point at which the level of profits or benefits gained is less than the amount of money or energy invested.
The enlargement of an organ or tissue (muscle in this case) from the increase in size of its cells.

\t\tThis number is the muscle growth you should expect this month assuming proper training and nutrition.\n\n \t\tYour monthly muscle growth is determined by a formula factoring in sex and experience. Most male individuals experience an average of 20, 10, 5 and 2.5 pounds of muscle growth in their first, second, third and fourth year respectively. About half that growth is expected for females.
\t\tThis number is your current fat loss potential to achieve 12% bodyfat if you’re a male and 20% bodyfat if you’re female.
The number you see on your dashboard is your caloric deviance, the difference between your caloric maintenance and desired caloric intake.
The number of calories that will maintain your current bodyweight.
The number of calories consumed in a day. It\'s numeric value can imply weight loss or gain, according to an individual\'s goals.

This is your current growth over your potential growth.

 		Your current growth is calculated based on the premise that a male builds 20, 10 ,5, and 2.5 pounds of muscle in their first, second, third, and fourth year respectively. About half that growth is expected for females. 

 		The total growth described here is assumed to be 45 pounds in 4 years for males and 22.5 pounds for females.
Here are a couple charts to visually asses your body composition. Aesthet(x) will help males achieve 12% bodyfat and 20 % bodyfat for females.
Maximum Adaptive Volume: The amount of quality sets an individual can perform weekly to maximize growth.
Maximum Recoverable Volume: The amount of quality sets an individual can perform weekly and realistically recover from.
"Your calculated calorie intake is the fastest for muscle growth"
Your calculated calorie intake is the fastest for muscle growth
